meanings.definition: Attracting attention in a vulgar manner
meanings.sent1: The meretricious decorations at the party were loud and flashy.
meanings.sent2: Her meretricious outfit was too revealing for the formal event.
meanings.sent3: The meretricious display of neon lights clashed with the elegant theme of the wedding.
meanings.sent4: The meretricious advertisement promised a luxurious lifestyle that was far from reality.
meanings.sent5: The meretricious makeup made her look like a clown rather than elegant.

meanings.definition: Superficially attractive but lacking real value
meanings.sent1: The meretricious jewelry sparkled but was made of cheap materials.
meanings.sent2: The salesman's meretricious pitch convinced many customers to buy the useless product.
meanings.sent3: The meretricious packaging of the product fooled customers into thinking it was high-quality.
meanings.sent4: Her meretricious smile hid the emptiness she felt inside.
meanings.sent5: The meretricious promises of the politician turned out to be empty lies.

meanings.sent1: The meretricious charm of the con artist fooled many unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent2: The meretricious facade of the building hid its deteriorating structure.
meanings.sent3: The meretricious advertisement for the miracle diet pill was too good to be true.
meanings.sent4: Her meretricious beauty masked a cunning and deceitful personality.
meanings.sent5: The meretricious allure of the haunted house attracted thrill-seekers looking for a scare.
